intro: Phelipanche resedarum, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers typically in shades of purple or pink. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind or animals. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive.
